Changes between version 0.6 and 0.7

There were some changes between versions 0.6 and 0.7. The most important is that some parts of API have changed. Good news are that if you are just using the framework and not extending it you should not notice. Anyway if your test do not work after upgrading to 0.7, here you will find how to fix it.

Request validators removal

Since version 0.7 there is no RequestValidator interface. Both RequestValidators and ResponseGenerator now implement ResponseGenerator interface. So form now on validators and generators are treated in the same way. The only difference is that validators either generate an exception or return null. If you have your own validators, please change their interface to ResponseGenerator.

Please also note, that validator collection has been removed from MockWebServiceConnection and MockWebServiceMessageSender. If you were using it, inject your validators into generators collection instead.

Validator semantic change

By treating validators in the same way as generators, the semantic changed a bit. Before, the validation exception was thrown from send method, now it is thrown from receive method. Again, in normal tests it should not affect you.

Ordering of request generators

Until version 0.6 the order of response generators was not deterministic if you used autowiring. From version 0.7 the generators can implement org.springframework.core.Ordered and then they will be ordered accordingly.
